programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The body of an adult-film actress (Deanna Wright) who was strangled is found by two college students in a park. The investigation turns up blood and human tissue from under the victim's nails that match the CEO of the company that distributes her movies. Later, incriminating evidence is compromised when a spill occurs in the lab. The incident is probed by Horatio's IA nemesis, Stetler, who flaunts the fact that he's dating Yelina. Jeffers: Vyto Ruginis. Kyle: Mike Erwin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs lose one of their own on the third-season opener, which begins with the discovery of a businessman's bullet-ridden body aboard an empty yacht that smashed into a bridge. Apparently, the man was delivering the ransom for his kidnapped son. Speedle: Rory Cochrane. Delko: Adam Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A woman is killed during a posh party at an exclusive waterfront estate when a man opens fire on the proceedings from a cigarette boat. When a former con is arrested, he acts as his own lawyer and proves to be smarter than he appears. Complicating matters is the fact that the leading witness in the case is the dead woman's 10-year-old son, whom Horatio wants to protect, refusing to let him testify.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A woman is killed when she is pushed in front of a bus. Later, a man's body is discovered down an elevator shaft in a nearby building, and there is evidence to link the victims to a common killer. Back at the lab, Calleigh's dad informs her that he may have accidentally killed someone while drinking and driving; and Horatio puts Speedle's replacement (Jonathan Togo) on the case. Seaver: Jonathan Silverman. Claudia: Meredith Monroe. Duquesne: John Heard. Katrina: Amelia Cook.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A student from an exclusive private high school is found dead in a sand trap at a ritzy country club after a flash mob made up of about 100 teens appears on the golf course and throws golf balls near a green where the body is located. Blood evidence discovered in the investigation leads Horatio to probe a missing-persons case involving a young Argentinean-American woman.(n)

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A rogue, 'Dirty Harry'-type detective enforces his own brand of tough justice ('works for me' was his catchphrase), and doesn't let red tape stand in the way. The son of a mobster, Det. Sgt. Rick Hunter is often paired with the no-nonsense Det. Sgt. Dee Dee McCall ('the brass cupcake') and often relies heavily on information from a savvy street hustler. After a successful 2002 TV-movie reunion, original stars Fred Dryer and Stepfanie Kramer reprised their roles for several new 'Hunter' episodes.(n)

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A rogue, 'Dirty Harry'-type detective enforces his own brand of tough justice ('works for me' was his catchphrase), and doesn't let red tape stand in the way. The son of a mobster, Det. Sgt. Rick Hunter is often paired with the no-nonsense Det. Sgt. Dee Dee McCall ('the brass cupcake') and often relies heavily on information from a savvy street hustler. After a successful 2002 TV-movie reunion, original stars Fred Dryer and Stepfanie Kramer reprised their roles for several new 'Hunter' episodes.(n)

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: CBS reworked its successful 'Hawaii Five-O' formula into a hit spun around a charismatic PI. The scenic backdrop and action-oriented drama were similar, and the initial time slots were identical. Often, reference was even made to Steve McGarrett of 'Five-O.' Magnum, however, was a lot more vulnerable and sensitive than McGarrett, traits more in tune with the times that helped contribute to the Emmy-winning Selleck's enormous appeal.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: An action-oriented modern-day Western about a Lone Star lawman who relies on martial arts to subdue bad guys. Walker's unsubtle butt-kicking ways are often at odds with those of his partners, who favor a more cerebral way of dealing with criminals. This was a popular if undemanding vehicle for deadpan karate champ and action-film star Chuck Norris (who even sang the title song).(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: In this taut and entertaining thriller, Detective 507 (Kikunosuke Onoe) is the leader of Detective Office Five, an elite branch of the Japanese police force that can deal with a wide variety of emergencies at a moment's notice. 507 and his crew are given an unusual assignment when they're sent to Shanghai to recover a vault full of treasure stashed there by Japanese soldiers during World War II. The riches have been stored in an ingeniously designed vault, and the code needed to crack the lock has been hidden in an unusual place -- a tattoo on the body of Meilan (Izumi Inamori), a beautiful nightclub performer. Somehow word gets out that Meilan is the key to finding the long-lost treasure, and 507 has to protect her from a steady stream of opportunists and former soldiers eager to get their hands on both her and the loot. Ango (aka The Code) was the first theatrical feature in eleven years from director Kaizo Hayashi after a detour into producing projects for television.(n)

programme.title: Mercenary for Justice

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: An action-oriented modern-day Western about a Lone Star lawman who relies on martial arts to subdue bad guys. Walker's unsubtle butt-kicking ways are often at odds with those of his partners, who favor a more cerebral way of dealing with criminals. This was a popular if undemanding vehicle for deadpan karate champ and action-film star Chuck Norris (who even sang the title song).(n)

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A rogue, 'Dirty Harry'-type detective enforces his own brand of tough justice ('works for me' was his catchphrase), and doesn't let red tape stand in the way. The son of a mobster, Det. Sgt. Rick Hunter is often paired with the no-nonsense Det. Sgt. Dee Dee McCall ('the brass cupcake') and often relies heavily on information from a savvy street hustler. After a successful 2002 TV-movie reunion, original stars Fred Dryer and Stepfanie Kramer reprised their roles for several new 'Hunter' episodes.(n)

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: CBS reworked its successful 'Hawaii Five-O' formula into a hit spun around a charismatic PI. The scenic backdrop and action-oriented drama were similar, and the initial time slots were identical. Often, reference was even made to Steve McGarrett of 'Five-O.' Magnum, however, was a lot more vulnerable and sensitive than McGarrett, traits more in tune with the times that helped contribute to the Emmy-winning Selleck's enormous appeal.(n)

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A rogue, 'Dirty Harry'-type detective enforces his own brand of tough justice ('works for me' was his catchphrase), and doesn't let red tape stand in the way. The son of a mobster, Det. Sgt. Rick Hunter is often paired with the no-nonsense Det. Sgt. Dee Dee McCall ('the brass cupcake') and often relies heavily on information from a savvy street hustler. After a successful 2002 TV-movie reunion, original stars Fred Dryer and Stepfanie Kramer reprised their roles for several new 'Hunter' episodes.(n)

programme.title: Hunter

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: CBS reworked its successful 'Hawaii Five-O' formula into a hit spun around a charismatic PI. The scenic backdrop and action-oriented drama were similar, and the initial time slots were identical. Often, reference was even made to Steve McGarrett of 'Five-O.' Magnum, however, was a lot more vulnerable and sensitive than McGarrett, traits more in tune with the times that helped contribute to the Emmy-winning Selleck's enormous appeal.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: An action-oriented modern-day Western about a Lone Star lawman who relies on martial arts to subdue bad guys. Walker's unsubtle butt-kicking ways are often at odds with those of his partners, who favor a more cerebral way of dealing with criminals. This was a popular if undemanding vehicle for deadpan karate champ and action-film star Chuck Norris (who even sang the title song).(n)

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: The Kratts travel to China and search for snub-nosed monkeys, which live in the snowy highlands.(n)

programme.title: Wild Kratts: Lost at Sea
programme.desc: The miniaturized Kratts are swept up in a current of plankton and become part of a crowd of fish larva that's headed to a coral reef; and later try to decipher the secret language of dolphins.(n)

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Cooking techniques and advice are featured.(n)

programme.title: Joanne Weir's Plates and Places
programme.desc: Joanne is having a love affair in Italy with tomatoes. She takes in the bounty of the Italian tomato harvest in Parma, Italy. Then she cooks up a classic lasagna along with her chef friend, Alaria. Joanne brings a bit of Italy back home and cooks up some unique tomato dishes.(n)

programme.title: This Old House Create Showcase: Charleston Project
programme.desc: The team takes on an old brick house with a charming fireplace that badly needs a new stove. Tom and Judith consider their options for the flooring while landscape expert Roger inspects the hidden gardens. Tom proposes using exposed brick for the interior casework.(n)

programme.title: This Old House Create Showcase: Charleston Project
programme.desc: Taking on a house that exudes old southern charm, the team starts by laying a new rear foundation. Landscape expert Roger examines a dying crepe myrtle tree to see if it can be salvaged. Host Kevin heads on to Fort Sumter to see the restoration of the house's lone mantel and the move to connect an old kitchen house to the main house.(n)

programme.title: Seeing the USA

programme.title: Born to Explore With Richard Wiese

programme.title: The Dictator's Playbook
programme.desc: The story of Italy's Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), who was a pioneer among 20th-century dictators. From undermining judges to indoctrinating children, he forged key tactics for seizing power. He also created fascism, an ideology that would plunge Europe into darkness.(n)

programme.title: Enemy of the Reich: Noor Inayat Khan Story
programme.desc: The story of Noor Inayat Khan, who served as a British spy and wireless operator for four months in Nazi-occupied Paris during WWII. Born in 1914, she was raised as a pacifist in Paris by her father, an Indian spiritual leader, and his American wife. However, after Germany's 1940 invasion, she fled to England and joined its Women's Auxiliary Air Force before being recruited by the SOE, a British espionage unit. She was captured in October 1943; and executed at Dachau a year later.(n)

This game show had several incarnations on network TV and in syndication, but throughout it was noted for the double-entendre humor and in-joking byplay among its celebrity panelists, including Charles Nelson Reilly and Richard Dawson (in a stint that launched his kissy-kissy 'Family Feud' career).(n)

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Home Shopping Network, a leading interactive multichannel retailer which offers a curated assortment of exclusive products combined with top brand names, offers innovative, differentiated retail experiences on television.(n)

programme.desc: Home Shopping Network, a leading interactive multichannel retailer which offers a curated assortment of exclusive products combined with top brand names, offers innovative, differentiated retail experiences on television.(n)

programme.title: Through the Bible with Les Feldick
programme.desc: A weekly series in which the host reads scripture passages.(n)

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Home Shopping Network, a leading interactive multichannel retailer which offers a curated assortment of exclusive products combined with top brand names, offers innovative, differentiated retail experiences on television.(n)

programme.title: To Tell the Truth
programme.desc: An artfully simple Goodson-Todman mainstay in which three players claimed to be the same person. Four celebrity panelists questioned them before voting on who was telling the truth, with incorrect guesses netting prize money for the contestants. The moment of truth always came with the familiar words, 'Will the real [name of person] please stand up?' The show was revived in syndication in 1980, hosted by Robin Ward; in 1990, with Gordon Elliott, then Lynn Swann; and in 2000, with John O'Hurley.(n)

programme.title: What's My Line?
programme.desc: One of the classic game shows (and one of the simplest), and the first hit for producers Mark Goodson and Bill Todman ('I've Got a Secret,' 'To Tell the Truth'). The panelists had to guess contestants' odd or not-so-odd jobs, then (while blindfolded) guess a celebrity guest's identity (New York Yankee Phil Rizzuto was the first). After its 17-year CBS run, 'Line' aired for another seven in syndication. Panelist Arlene Francis stuck it out all 24 years.(n)

programme.title: Concentration
programme.desc: One of NBC's longest-running programs, this seminal game show was a daytime staple from 1958 to '73, with forays into prime time in '58 and '61. Of all the emcees who revealed the rebus (Ed McMahon and Bob Clayton among them), Hugh Downs is the one best remembered. In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Sweep
programme.desc: Contestants at a supermarket rush to fill their carts with as many items as possible and, in a bonus round, find hidden cash. The original version, which was taped at actual supermarkets, aired on ABC from 1965 to 1967. The revival, which began in 1990, first aired on Lifetime before moving to PAX.(n)

programme.title: Body Language
programme.desc: Contestants are partnered with celebrities in this charades-style game in which 'their bodies do the talking,' as host Tom Kennedy puts it.(n)

programme.title: Blockbusters
programme.desc: A player competes against a pair of family members answering trivia questions in a race to connect a path across a game board.(n)

programme.title: Match Game Hollywood Squares Hour
programme.desc: Game show that combines "Match Game" and "Hollywood Squares.".(n)

programme.desc: 'Dumb Dora was so dumb that...' is a typical lead-in to 'fill-in-the-blank'-style queries asked of contestants seeking to match celebrities' answers. This game show had several incarnations on network TV and in syndication, but throughout it was noted for the double-entendre humor and in-joking byplay among its celebrity panelists, including Charles Nelson Reilly and Richard Dawson (in a stint that launched his kissy-kissy 'Family Feud' career).(n)

programme.title: Classic Concentration

programme.title: Password
programme.desc: A Goodson-Todman classic in which celebrity-contestant teams compete in a word-association game, with each player giving only one-word clues. Subsequent versions of the show were titled 'Password Plus' and 'Super Password.'.(n)

programme.title: Password Plus
programme.desc: Contestants---including celebrities---compete for cash prizes in an updated version of the classic game show.(n)

programme.title: Super Password
programme.desc: A new edition of the game, featuring jackpots worth thousands of dollars, and a 'cash word,' worth $1000 or more for guessing a single word.(n)

programme.title: Tattletales
programme.desc: Celebrities and their spouses tried to match answers to host Bert Convy's questions on this game show. While one spouse sat backstage (and out of earshot), the other would answer the host's questions. Then the offstage player would give their response while sitting before a monitor.(n)

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Players answer questions to earn 'spins' on a giant board in this daytime favorite from the 1980s. What they want, of course, is cash, merchandise or vacations, but, to use the series catchphrase, 'no whammys,' which would mean watching a cartoon ogre confiscate all their swag. The format was later revived by the Game Show Network during the 2002-03 season.(n)

programme.title: Card Sharks
programme.desc: Contestants guess whether high or low cards from a deck will be revealed in a popular game show that in later versions included contestants predicting the outcome of surveys.(n)

programme.title: Super Password

programme.title: Tattletales
programme.desc: Celebrities and their spouses tried to match answers to host Bert Convy's questions on this game show. While one spouse sat backstage (and out of earshot), the other would answer the host's questions. Then the offstage player would give their response while sitting before a monitor.(n)

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Players answer questions to earn 'spins' on a giant board in this daytime favorite from the 1980s. What they want, of course, is cash, merchandise or vacations, but, to use the series catchphrase, 'no whammys,' which would mean watching a cartoon ogre confiscate all their swag. The format was later revived by the Game Show Network during the 2002-03 season.(n)

programme.title: To Tell the Truth
programme.desc: An artfully simple Goodson-Todman mainstay in which three players claimed to be the same person. Four celebrity panelists questioned them before voting on who was telling the truth, with incorrect guesses netting prize money for the contestants. The moment of truth always came with the familiar words, 'Will the real [name of person] please stand up?' The show was revived in syndication in 1980, hosted by Robin Ward; in 1990, with Gordon Elliott, then Lynn Swann; and in 2000, with John O'Hurley.(n)

programme.title: What's My Line?
programme.desc: One of the classic game shows (and one of the simplest), and the first hit for producers Mark Goodson and Bill Todman ('I've Got a Secret,' 'To Tell the Truth'). The panelists had to guess contestants' odd or not-so-odd jobs, then (while blindfolded) guess a celebrity guest's identity (New York Yankee Phil Rizzuto was the first). After its 17-year CBS run, 'Line' aired for another seven in syndication. Panelist Arlene Francis stuck it out all 24 years.(n)

programme.title: Concentration
programme.desc: One of NBC's longest-running programs, this seminal game show was a daytime staple from 1958 to '73, with forays into prime time in '58 and '61. Of all the emcees who revealed the rebus (Ed McMahon and Bob Clayton among them), Hugh Downs is the one best remembered. In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Sweep
programme.desc: Contestants at a supermarket rush to fill their carts with as many items as possible and, in a bonus round, find hidden cash. programme.desc: Contestants are partnered with celebrities in this charades-style game in which 'their bodies do the talking,' as host Tom Kennedy puts it.(n)

The original version, which was taped at actual supermarkets, aired on ABC from 1965 to 1967. The revival, which began in 1990, first aired on Lifetime before moving to PAX.(n)

programme.title: To Tell the Truth
programme.desc: An artfully simple Goodson-Todman mainstay in which three players claimed to be the same person. Four celebrity panelists questioned them before voting on who was telling the truth, with incorrect guesses netting prize money for the contestants. The moment of truth always came with the familiar words, 'Will the real [name of person] please stand up?' The show was revived in syndication in 1980, hosted by Robin Ward; in 1990, with Gordon Elliott, then Lynn Swann; and in 2000, with John O'Hurley.(n)

programme.title: To Tell the Truth

The show was revived in syndication in 1980, hosted by Robin Ward; in 1990, with Gordon Elliott, then Lynn Swann; and in 2000, with John O'Hurley.(n)

programme.title: Password
programme.desc: A Goodson-Todman classic in which celebrity-contestant teams compete in a word-association game, with each player giving only one-word clues. Subsequent versions of the show were titled 'Password Plus' and 'Super Password.'.(n)

programme.desc: Contestants try to find one-word answers hidden in lines of scrambled letters in this Goodson-Todman game.(n)

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Players answer questions to earn 'spins' on a giant board in this daytime favorite from the 1980s. What they want, of course, is cash, merchandise or vacations, but, to use the series catchphrase, 'no whammys,' which would mean watching a cartoon ogre confiscate all their swag. The format was later revived by the Game Show Network during the 2002-03 season.(n)

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: 'Dumb Dora was so dumb that...' is a typical lead-in to 'fill-in-the-blank'-style queries asked of contestants seeking to match celebrities' answers. This game show had several incarnations on network TV and in syndication, but throughout it was noted for the double-entendre humor and in-joking byplay among its celebrity panelists, including Charles Nelson Reilly and Richard Dawson (in a stint that launched his kissy-kissy 'Family Feud' career).(n)

programme.desc: Game show that combines "Match Game" and "Hollywood Squares.".(n)

programme.title: Concentration
programme.desc: One of NBC's longest-running programs, this seminal game show was a daytime staple from 1958 to '73, with forays into prime time in '58 and '61. Of all the emcees who revealed the rebus (Ed McMahon and Bob Clayton among them), Hugh Downs is the one best remembered. In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Concentration

In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Tattletales
programme.desc: Celebrities and their spouses tried to match answers to host Bert Convy's questions on this game show. While one spouse sat backstage (and out of earshot), the other would answer the host's questions. Then the offstage player would give their response while sitting before a monitor.(n)

programme.title: Sale of the Century
programme.desc: Three contestants answer rapid-fire, general-knowledge questions for the chance to buy big-ticket items at bargain prices. The winner may keep the prize or risk it the next day for a shot at something better.(n)

programme.title: What's My Line?
programme.desc: One of the classic game shows (and one of the simplest), and the first hit for producers Mark Goodson and Bill Todman ('I've Got a Secret,' 'To Tell the Truth'). The panelists had to guess contestants' odd or not-so-odd jobs, then (while blindfolded) guess a celebrity guest's identity (New York Yankee Phil Rizzuto was the first). After its 17-year CBS run, 'Line' aired for another seven in syndication. Panelist Arlene Francis stuck it out all 24 years.(n)

After its 17-year CBS run, 'Line' aired for another seven in syndication. Panelist Arlene Francis stuck it out all 24 years.(n)

programme.title: Concentration
programme.desc: One of NBC's longest-running programs, this seminal game show was a daytime staple from 1958 to '73, with forays into prime time in '58 and '61. Of all the emcees who revealed the rebus (Ed McMahon and Bob Clayton among them), Hugh Downs is the one best remembered. In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Sweep
programme.desc: Contestants at a supermarket rush to fill their carts with as many items as possible and, in a bonus round, find hidden cash. The original version, which was taped at actual supermarkets, aired on ABC from 1965 to 1967. The revival, which began in 1990, first aired on Lifetime before moving to PAX.(n)

programme.title: Body Language
programme.desc: Contestants are partnered with celebrities in this charades-style game in which 'their bodies do the talking,' as host Tom Kennedy puts it.(n)

programme.title: Blockbusters
programme.desc: A player competes against a pair of family members answering trivia questions in a race to connect a path across a game board.(n)

programme.title: Match Game Hollywood Squares Hour
programme.desc: Game show that combines "Match Game" and "Hollywood Squares.".(n)

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: 'Dumb Dora was so dumb that...' is a typical lead-in to 'fill-in-the-blank'-style queries asked of contestants seeking to match celebrities' answers. This game show had several incarnations on network TV and in syndication, but throughout it was noted for the double-entendre humor and in-joking byplay among its celebrity panelists, including Charles Nelson Reilly and Richard Dawson (in a stint that launched his kissy-kissy 'Family Feud' career).(n)

programme.title: Password
programme.desc: A Goodson-Todman classic in which celebrity-contestant teams compete in a word-association game, with each player giving only one-word clues. Subsequent versions of the show were titled 'Password Plus' and 'Super Password.'.(n)

programme.title: Password Plus
programme.desc: Contestants---including celebrities---compete for cash prizes in an updated version of the classic game show.(n)

programme.title: Super Password
programme.desc: A new edition of the game, featuring jackpots worth thousands of dollars, and a 'cash word,' worth $1000 or more for guessing a single word.(n)

programme.title: Tattletales
programme.desc: Celebrities and their spouses tried to match answers to host Bert Convy's questions on this game show. While one spouse sat backstage (and out of earshot), the other would answer the host's questions. Then the offstage player would give their response while sitting before a monitor.(n)

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Players answer questions to earn 'spins' on a giant board in this daytime favorite from the 1980s. What they want, of course, is cash, merchandise or vacations, but, to use the series catchphrase, 'no whammys,' which would mean watching a cartoon ogre confiscate all their swag. The format was later revived by the Game Show Network during the 2002-03 season.(n)

programme.title: To Tell the Truth
programme.desc: An artfully simple Goodson-Todman mainstay in which three players claimed to be the same person. Four celebrity panelists questioned them before voting on who was telling the truth, with incorrect guesses netting prize money for the contestants. The moment of truth always came with the familiar words, 'Will the real [name of person] please stand up?' The show was revived in syndication in 1980, hosted by Robin Ward; in 1990, with Gordon Elliott, then Lynn Swann; and in 2000, with John O'Hurley.(n)

programme.title: What's My Line?
programme.desc: One of the classic game shows (and one of the simplest), and the first hit for producers Mark Goodson and Bill Todman ('I've Got a Secret,' 'To Tell the Truth'). After its 17-year CBS run, 'Line' aired for another seven in syndication. Panelist Arlene Francis stuck it out all 24 years.(n)

programme.title: To Tell the Truth
programme.desc: An artfully simple Goodson-Todman mainstay in which three players claimed to be the same person. Four celebrity panelists questioned them before voting on who was telling the truth, with incorrect guesses netting prize money for the contestants. The moment of truth always came with the familiar words, 'Will the real [name of person] please stand up?' The show was revived in syndication in 1980, hosted by Robin Ward; in 1990, with Gordon Elliott, then Lynn Swann; and in 2000, with John O'Hurley.(n)

programme.title: What's My Line?
programme.desc: One of the classic game shows (and one of the simplest), and the first hit for producers Mark Goodson and Bill Todman ('I've Got a Secret,' 'To Tell the Truth'). The panelists had to guess contestants' odd or not-so-odd jobs, then (while blindfolded) guess a celebrity guest's identity (New York Yankee Phil Rizzuto was the first). After its 17-year CBS run, 'Line' aired for another seven in syndication. Panelist Arlene Francis stuck it out all 24 years.(n)

programme.title: Concentration
programme.desc: One of NBC's longest-running programs, this seminal game show was a daytime staple from 1958 to '73, with forays into prime time in '58 and '61. Of all the emcees who revealed the rebus (Ed McMahon and Bob Clayton among them), Hugh Downs is the one best remembered. In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Sweep
programme.desc: Contestants at a supermarket rush to fill their carts with as many items as possible and, in a bonus round, find hidden cash. The original version, which was taped at actual supermarkets, aired on ABC from 1965 to 1967. The revival, which began in 1990, first aired on Lifetime before moving to PAX.(n)

programme.title: Body Language
programme.desc: Contestants are partnered with celebrities in this charades-style game in which 'their bodies do the talking,' as host Tom Kennedy puts it.(n)

programme.title: Blockbusters
programme.desc: A player competes against a pair of family members answering trivia questions in a race to connect a path across a game board.(n)

programme.title: Password Plus
programme.desc: Contestants---including celebrities---compete for cash prizes in an updated version of the classic game show.(n)

programme.title: Super Password
programme.desc: A new edition of the game, featuring jackpots worth thousands of dollars, and a 'cash word,' worth $1000 or more for guessing a single word.(n)

programme.title: Tattletales
programme.desc: Celebrities and their spouses tried to match answers to host Bert Convy's questions on this game show. While one spouse sat backstage (and out of earshot), the other would answer the host's questions. Then the offstage player would give their response while sitting before a monitor.(n)

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Players answer questions to earn 'spins' on a giant board in this daytime favorite from the 1980s. What they want, of course, is cash, merchandise or vacations, but, to use the series catchphrase, 'no whammys,' which would mean watching a cartoon ogre confiscate all their swag. The format was later revived by the Game Show Network during the 2002-03 season.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Heroes
programme.desc: The pit-crew competition at the 1984 Indianapolis 500, which was won by Michael Andretti's team. Host: Paul Page.(n)

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: "Come on down!" Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes.(n)

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: 'Dumb Dora was so dumb that...' is a typical lead-in to 'fill-in-the-blank'-style queries asked of contestants seeking to match celebrities' answers. This game show had several incarnations on network TV and in syndication, but throughout it was noted for the double-entendre humor and in-joking byplay among its celebrity panelists, including Charles Nelson Reilly and Richard Dawson (in a stint that launched his kissy-kissy 'Family Feud' career).(n)

programme.title: Concentration
programme.desc: One of NBC's longest-running programs, this seminal game show was a daytime staple from 1958 to '73, with forays into prime time in '58 and '61. Of all the emcees who revealed the rebus (Ed McMahon and Bob Clayton among them), Hugh Downs is the one best remembered. In 1987, the series was resurrected as 'Classic Concentration,' with Alex Trebek as host until the show's end in 1994.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami

The other man is found dead in his car, an apparent accident victim, but the evidence points to murder.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A man finds his wife's bloody body after she apparently fell down the stairs in their home. Grissom and his crew investigate and the evidence points to murder. The probe reveals that the husband's previous wife died in a similar manner and that he is involved with another woman who has a biting fetish. The husband claims he was asleep outside by the pool when the death occurred. Ray: Reed Diamond. Becky: Abigail Spencer. Susan: Skye McCole Bartusiak.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The bodies of 11 cult members who drank poison are found by Grissom and Catherine in an old underground military bunker in the desert. They stumble upon the grisly find while investigating the death of a man who was badly beaten and dumped in a backyard that borders the desert. Believing the body was dragged to the yard, Gil and Catherine follow drag marks and a dozen sets of footprints into the desert, where they find the bunker.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A family of four who lived in a small Nevada town is believed to have been murdered in their home. Nick takes the lead in the case and discovers three pools of blood in the house, but no bodies. As the investigation intensifies, Nick comes to believe that the youngest victim, a 10-year-old girl, may still be alive. But Sara disagrees. She thinks Nick is getting too emotionally involved because of his recent near-death experience.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A 28-year-old single mother is found shot to death in her home in what looks like a suicide, but Catherine determines quickly that the victim was murdered. The autopsy reveals that the woman was a virgin, but that she had also given birth. Back at the lab, Grissom is summoned by Ecklie to refute the testimony of an expert entomologist in a murder trial in order to prevent a killer from going free.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Part 1 of two. A rookie police officer is killed during a shoot-out with four Hispanic gang members after a high-speed chase. The investigation reveals that the officer may not have been killed by a gang member, but rather by so-called friendly fire. Grissom and his crew search a crime scene that stretches for miles to determine what really happened. Bell: Daniel Bess. Davis: Colby French. Ortega: Nestor Serrano.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Conclusion. After a rookie cop is fatally wounded during a gun battle between police and gang members, the only suspect is gunned down as he's taken into custody. But Grissom fears that the cop was actually killed by so-called friendly fire from another officer. The investigation reveals that the gang members were involved with drug dealers.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: An obese man is found dead in a Dumpster outside of a restaurant on Thanksgiving and his hands are filled with mashed potatoes. The investigation leads Grissom and Catherine into the world of competitive eating. Across town, Nick and Sara probe the deaths of a husband and wife on the verge of divorce who were apparently attacked by a vicious dog. A golden retriever is found at the scene, but he hardly seems like a killer.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom and his team investigate when a 6-year-old boy is reportedly kidnapped from a park where he was playing. The child's mother claims her son was on a swing set shortly before he disappeared. The investigation reveals that the mother is a widow and that she feared her late husband's military father would take the boy from her. Later, Nick is visited by Kelly Gordon, the daughter of the man who abducted Nick and buried him alive.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A man suffering from human werewolf syndrome, a condition that causes excessive hair growth, is found shot to death in his home with a silver bullet in his chest. The police are alerted to the crime by a mysterious call from a phone booth. The investigation reveals that the victim had a large online gambling debt and was recently threatened by the web site's owner. The CSIs also learn that the dead man was engaged to be married.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A professional motocross racer is stabbed to death while working on his bike in a garage attached to a house he shared with two women he recently met. The investigation reveals that the victim was about to leave town with the younger of the two women. Across town, a woman is run over by her own car in a parking garage. Nick investigates and discovers that the dead woman was an accountant for Kelly Gordon's father, the man who abducted Nick.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A waiter is murdered at an exclusive party hosted by a once glamorous Vegas showgirl (Faye Dunaway) who has ties to the mob. The woman believes she was the intended target because she just wrote a tell-all memoir. The case gets personal for Catherine when she learns that her father, Sam Braun, was at the party and is a suspect in the murder. Lily: Anita Gillette. Braun: Scott Wilson.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A killer murders a man in a run-down apartment building and then is involved in an accident when a young woman smashes into his car at an intersection two blocks from the crime scene. To prevent her from calling the police, he strangles her to death and then drives away. At first, the two crimes are investigated separately, but soon evidence shows they are connected.(n)

programme.title: 35 Serial Killers The World Wants to Forget
programme.desc: The Night Stalker and the Hillside Stranglers continue to prey in California; while northern England is threatened by the Yorkshire Ripper.(n)

programme.title: 35 Serial Killers The World Wants to Forget
programme.desc: Chester Turner is the most prolific serial killer in the history of Los Angeles according to LAPD. Joanna Dennehy became only the third woman in U.K. history to be jailed forever without parole for her brutal murders of three men. In Sydney, the most vulnerable of residents were at risk from the "Granny Killer.".(n)

programme.title: 35 Serial Killers The World Wants to Forget
programme.desc: Dr. Shipman had for years cunningly disguised his addiction to drugs and killing his patients. Dorothea Puente appeared to be a mild care home manager. So when police detective John Cabrera knocked on her door it was for information and not the haul of bodies he would eventually find.(n)

programme.title: 35 Serial Killers The World Wants to Forget
programme.desc: Between 1986 and 1987, the bodies of missing young women were dug up around Sacramento, California. The locations all shared a trait: handyman Maurice Solomon Jr. had either worked or lived there. For 13 months, violent ex-con Mark Goudeau murdered, kidnapped, sexually assaulted and robbed around Baseline Road in Phoenix, Arizona.(n)

programme.title: 35 Serial Killers The World Wants to Forget
programme.desc: Richard Chase was labelled the Vampire of Sacramento by police. He had a lust for blood whose depravity would include rape, murder, mutilation, cannibalism and necrophilia. Roger and Verna Stafford were armed robbers responsible for what would be the worst killings in the State of Oklahoma for nearly 20 years.(n)

programme.title: 35 Serial Killers The World Wants to Forget
programme.desc: Army veteran and ex-police officer Dennis Nilsen asphyxiated young men, stored their bodies before dismembering them. Rodney Alcala was a sadistic rapist and serial killer who had murdered four women by the time he appeared on the popular television show, "The Dating Game." Thrill Killer J R Chavez terrorized Dallas, shooting dead five people in one night.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: A wine counterfeiter bilks wealthy oenophiles out of tens of thousands of dollars.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: A military contractor is accused of using company funds to pay for his daughter's $10 million party, cosmetic surgery for his wife and a $100,000 belt buckle.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.sub-title: The Lawyer Lies; Black Gold Bust
programme.desc: A personal-injury lawyer in Indiana steals his clients' settlement awards; investors find guarantees of returns are worthless on oil wells in Kentucky.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: A look at a Ponzi scheme involving a brokerage company that bought life-insurance policies held by people with terminal illnesses and resold them to investors at a discount.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: A James Bond wannabe poses as a polished private-security contractor who makes promises to clients and investors that are somehow never delivered.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.sub-title: Jersey Car Stealer Dealer; Facebook Face-Off
programme.desc: A luxury car salesman is wanted for defrauding customers and banks; a man faces mail and wire fraud charges related to claims that he owned a percentage of Facebook.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: In the Season 9 finale, a New York stockbroker oversees an international, boiler-room operation that defrauds investors out of $140 million.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: The Season 10 premiere profiles Ray Nagin, a former two-term mayor of New Orleans who was sentenced to 10 years in prison for bribery and fraud in 2014.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.sub-title: Hook, Line & Sucker; Maxfield Parrish Art Hiest
programme.desc: The story of Barry Hunt, a scam artist who pleaded guilty to mail fraud and bank fraud. Also: footage of an unsolved art heist in West Hollywood.(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.sub-title: Religious Prey: Baptist Foundation of Arizona; Medical Scams: Dr. Mikos
programme.desc: A Ponzi scheme; a doctor's fraud.(n)

programme.desc: A Birmingham man is killed over marijuana in the childhood neighborhood of the investigating detective.(n)

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: Miami detectives investigate the murder of a 20-year old who was shot during a robbery on Christmas Day.(n)

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A love triangle leads to murder in Louisville; and Dallas detectives investigate the death of a driver and a critically injured passenger.(n)

programme.title: The First 48
programme.sub-title: Blind Rage; Those Closest to Us
programme.desc: In Birmingham, a 28-year-old man is shot in his home; and a homeless man is stabbed in a Miami park.(n)

programme.desc: Body parts are found floating in Miami's Biscayne Bay.(n)

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A father is stabbed to death in Louisville, and detectives travel to Tennessee in pursuit of three suspects; and, in Texas, detectives investigate the murder of a man who was shot to death in a bar.(n)

programme.title: The First 48
programme.sub-title: Eye for an Eye; Dead End
programme.desc: Louisville detectives investigate the shooting death of a young man murdered in broad daylight; and the body of a Birmingham teen is found in the passenger seat of his car.(n)

programme.title: Unsolved Mysteries
programme.desc: Unsolved cases were examined in this popular reality-based anthology, which became an NBC series after the success of a special hosted by Raymond Burr. Using reenactments and interviews with law officers and investigators, the program looked at various crimes, missing-person cases and occasional stories of the supernatural.(n)

programme.desc: A Sudanese man who fled the genocide in Darfur is shot to death in Louisville; and a Birmingham man is murdered in his home, and his girlfriend survives multiple gunshots.(n)

programme.desc: A man is shot to death during a robbery in Texas; and Birmingham detectives investigate the murder of a mother of two.(n)

programme.title: The First 48

programme.title: The First 48

programme.title: The First 48

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Killings in Abbotsford, British Columbia, are examined.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Convicted killer David Snow, who murdered a Toronto couple in 1992, is profiled.(n)

programme.desc: Recalling the case of Ronald West, a former Toronto cop who pleaded guilty to sexually assaulting and killing two nurses in 1970.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Examining the case of serial killer Wayne Boden, known as the "Vampire Rapist" for the signature bite marks left on his victims.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories

programme.title: Crime Stories

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is assaulted during a carjacking and left for dead by the side of a road. She's taken to a hospital where she fights for her life and that of her unborn baby. The investigation reveals the victim was targeted and that she had an argument with a friend a short time earlier.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A sugar refinery explodes and one man is found dead inside. The investigation reveals the victim died because of foul play and that the refinery owner took cost-saving shortcuts that may have caused the blast.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A millionaire is killed by an alligator in his swimming pool, and the evidence suggests he was murdered. The investigation leads to an elite dating service the victim used. Ryan goes undercover and poses as a rich businessman to expose the truth behind the questionable matchmaking enterprise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man and a woman are gunned down along a residential street, but water from a damaged fire hydrant threatens to wash away all of the evidence. The investigation reveals the victims may not be connected but may have been killed with the same bullet.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A female Roller Derby competitor is murdered during a match when she visits the locker room after becoming sick on the track. The investigation reveals she may have been abused prior to joining the team and that it could have contributed to her death.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The state attorney is gunned down during a press conference following a drug raid and a public defender appointed to represent one of the suspects is murdered. The investigation leads Horatio to the man who murdered his wife and who wants to reclaim Miami as his turf.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A high-school bully who routinely humiliated her classmates is kidnapped, tied to a goalpost and stoned to death, following a party where she publicly embarrassed a nerdy girl. The probe reveals most everyone hated the victim and is glad she's dead.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Two women are kidnapped and held in an abandoned house where one of them is strangled to death. The other woman narrowly escapes from the killer and notifies the police. The investigation soon leads to another victim buried in a state park, and Horatio launches an all-out hunt for the serial killer.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: An exclusive hunting club where the prey is human is uncovered by the CSIs after a man is killed with a bow and arrow in the Everglades. The probe reveals the victim is an illegal immigrant who was sold into slavery for the purpose of being hunted. Series star Adam Rodriguez wrote and directed the episode.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A delivery-truck driver and a businesswoman on his route are murdered, and the CSIs investigate to uncover the connection between the two victims. The probe reveals that the driver was sleeping with women on his route and may have been stealing from customers.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Natalia is taken hostage by a convicted murderer who escaped from prison just as another victim he is suspected of killing is discovered. But the man tells Natalia that he is innocent of both crimes and wants her to help him prove it.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio tries to protect a mixed-martial-arts fighter from his brother, who recently escaped from prison.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A college girl's throat is slashed while she sits alone in a hot tub late at night. The investigation centers on the victim's roommate, who was the last one to see her alive and may possess a dual personality.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is murdered shortly after getting into a fight at a singles bar, but the body disappears before the police arrive. Also missing is the chief suspect, who slugged the victim and was seen with the bloody body shortly before it vanished.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The ninth season concludes with Horatio hunting an escaped fugitive who fled a transport plane when it made an emergency landing in Miami. The investigation intensifies when the convict kills one woman, kidnaps a teen and sends another to a watery grave.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The 10th season begins with Horatio bleeding from a gunshot wound and Natalia battling to free herself from the trunk of a submerged car, as the other CSIs try to capture an escaped murderer before he kills again.(n)

programme.desc: Suspects in a wealthy man's murder are his young widow (Andrea Roth) and a contractor (Daniel Sunjata) with whom she was romantically involved. Luisa: Liza Colon-Zayas. Aaron Solomon: John Benjamin Hickey. Davis: Bill Cohen. Miller: Anthony Grasso.(n)

It was, literally, pie-in-the-face humor, with Sales claiming that he's had more than 25,000 whipped-cream facials. programme.title: The Adventures of Ozzie & Harriet
programme.desc: TV's longest-running live-action comedy was the brainchild of lawyer-turned-bandleader Ozzie Nelson and began on the radio in 1944. There wasn't, in fact, much 'adventure' anyone could discern in the lives of the suburban Nelson clan (nor was it ever exactly clear what the TV Ozzie did for a living), but this wholesome sitcom ran for 14 years (and a remarkable 435 episodes), and made a bona fide rock-and-roll star out of younger son Rick.(n)

programme.title: I Married Joan
programme.desc: Gifted comedian Joan Davis played the wife of a domestic court judge who regaled couples in his courtroom with tales of his experiences at home. Among a slew of contemporary zany-housewife shows, this had neither the cachet nor the consistency of 'I Love Lucy,' but it was a popular and underrated sitcom that nicely showcased Davis's gifts for physical comedy.(n)

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The masked man and Tonto rode from radio to TV with a 'hearty heigh-ho Silver, away!', accompanied by Rossini's stirring 'William Tell Overture.' ABC's first ratings hit and one of early TV's most popular series, it told of the lone survivor of an ambush of Texas Rangers, who was found by the Indian Tonto. Tonto helped his 'kemo sabe' (trusty scout) right wrongs...all without killing anyone. Clayton Moore also played the Lone Ranger in two 1950s theatrical films.(n)

programme.title: Adventures of Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Cowgirl Annie Oakley embarks on a series of adventures in the American West with her horse Target and her younger brother Tagg.(n)

programme.title: The Doctors
programme.desc: Romance made the rounds on this lively, long-running drama about bed-hopping healers at a metropolitan medical center. It premiered the same day as 'General Hospital.' Originally an anthology series, it switched to a serialized format in 1964 and went to color two years later. In 1972, it scored the Daytime Emmy for Best Drama.(n)

programme.title: Ray Bradbury Theater
programme.desc: The sci-fi author's works were adapted for this anthology series, which included appearances by notable actors.(n)

programme.title: Police Surgeon
programme.desc: After one season of 'Dr. Simon Locke,' the title character left small-town life for the big city and became the head of the police department's medical-emergency unit. There he helped investigate crimes that involved the people he treated, because apparently he didn't have enough to do as a doctor.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary detective uses his keen powers of deduction in a series of cases which first aired on PBS's 'Mystery.'.(n)

programme.title: Naked City
programme.desc: An unusually raw and realistic (for its time) drama about New York City cops that was strong on character development and location filming. After an initial season of half-hour episodes, the show was canceled, but returned a year later as an hourlong series for a three-season run that included early-career guest roles for such notables as Diahann Carroll, Sandy Dennis, Peter Fonda, Dustin Hoffman, Robert Redford and Jon Voight. Based on the 1948 movie 'The Naked City.'.(n)

programme.title: Route 66
programme.desc: A superior 1960s series about friends Tod Stiles and Buz Murdock driving across the U.S. in a Corvette. Along the way, of course, they encountered and helped plenty of interesting (often troubled) people. Among the guests who appeared were Robert Redford, Alan Alda, Rod Steiger and Ethel Waters (in an Emmy-nominated performance as a dying blues singer). Nelson Riddle composed the series' classic theme. The show was revived unsuccessfully in the summer of 1993.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: A cult favorite about the journeys through the universe of a time-traveling eccentric, a cultural icon who has been portrayed by more than a half dozen actors since the show's 1963 debut on the BBC. programme.title: Daytime
programme.desc: An interview show featuring celebrity guests.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ozzie & Harriet
programme.desc: TV's longest-running live-action comedy was the brainchild of lawyer-turned-bandleader Ozzie Nelson and began on the radio in 1944. There wasn't, in fact, much 'adventure' anyone could discern in the lives of the suburban Nelson clan (nor was it ever exactly clear what the TV Ozzie did for a living), but this wholesome sitcom ran for 14 years (and a remarkable 435 episodes), and made a bona fide rock-and-roll star out of younger son Rick.(n)

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A widow and her three daughters (and Uncle Joe, who's a-movin' kinda slow) run the Shady Rest Hotel in Hooterville, whose clientele consists mainly of passengers on the spur line of an almost-defunct railroad. It was one of many rural sitcoms that populated CBS acreage during the 1960s (this series inspired---and shared characters with---the equally popular 'Green Acres'). Despite a revolving door of cast changes, the gentle, down-home comedy had a successful seven-year run.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Assignment
programme.desc: A U.S. government agent travels the world on undercover missions in this 1950s series. Star Brian Donlevy originated the role on radio in the '40s.(n)

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: If nothing else, this Western abut a frontier detective was different for its jazz score (composed by Gerald Fried) and odd mix of guest stars, ranging from Ernie Kovacs to NFL great Elroy 'Crazylegs' Hirsch.(n)

programme.title: Adventures of Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Cowgirl Annie Oakley embarks on a series of adventures in the American West with her horse Target and her younger brother Tagg.(n)

programme.title: The Doctors
programme.desc: Romance made the rounds on this lively, long-running drama about bed-hopping healers at a metropolitan medical center. It premiered the same day as 'General Hospital.' Originally an anthology series, it switched to a serialized format in 1964 and went to color two years later. In 1972, it scored the Daytime Emmy for Best Drama.(n)

programme.title: Ray Bradbury Theater
programme.desc: The sci-fi author's works were adapted for this anthology series, which included appearances by notable actors.(n)

programme.title: Police Surgeon
programme.desc: After one season of 'Dr. Simon Locke,' the title character left small-town life for the big city and became the head of the police department's medical-emergency unit. There he helped investigate crimes that involved the people he treated, because apparently he didn't have enough to do as a doctor.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary detective uses his keen powers of deduction in a series of cases which first aired on PBS's 'Mystery.'.(n)

programme.title: Naked City
programme.desc: An unusually raw and realistic (for its time) drama about New York City cops that was strong on character development and location filming. After an initial season of half-hour episodes, the show was canceled, but returned a year later as an hourlong series for a three-season run that included early-career guest roles for such notables as Diahann Carroll, Sandy Dennis, Peter Fonda, Dustin Hoffman, Robert Redford and Jon Voight. Based on the 1948 movie 'The Naked City.'.(n)

programme.title: Route 66
programme.desc: A superior 1960s series about friends Tod Stiles and Buz Murdock driving across the U.S. in a Corvette. Along the way, of course, they encountered and helped plenty of interesting (often troubled) people. Among the guests who appeared were Robert Redford, Alan Alda, Rod Steiger and Ethel Waters (in an Emmy-nominated performance as a dying blues singer). Nelson Riddle composed the series' classic theme. The show was revived unsuccessfully in the summer of 1993.(n)

programme.title: Life With Elizabeth
programme.desc: Comic vignettes (three per show) about a young woman and her junior-exec husband. Betty White not only was the star but was the series' co-creator and co-producer as well, an accomplishment rare in the early 1950s. 'Elizabeth,' White's first comic role on TV, debuted on a local station in Los Angeles in 1952.(n)

programme.title: The Lucy Show
programme.desc: The TV icon plays a widow living with best bud Vivian and their kids while she works as a secretary for long-suffering banker Mr. Mooney. Five years after 'I Love Lucy,' and without Desi, Ball scored another hit series that showcased her gift for physical comedy and her chemistry with old cohort Vivian Vance (who left after the third season). After undergoing a format change in 1968, it was retitled 'Here's Lucy.'.(n)

programme.title: Public Defender
programme.desc: Reed Hadley's follow-up series to 'Racket Squad' casts him as a lawyer 'responsible for giving legal aid without cost' (as the opening narration put it).(n)

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: 'King of the Cowboys' Roy Rogers headlined this popular kids-oriented series, along with his real-life wife, Dale Evans. They played ranchers trying to preserve the peace in the modern-day West. Pat Brady was Rogers' sidekick and the Sons of the Pioneers provided music support (as they did in many of Rogers' Republic Westerns).(n)

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: CBS hit a ratings gusher with this rustic sitcom about a poor mountaineer turned oil baron who relocated, along with his eccentric clan, to 'the hills of Beverly.' The series frequently topped the Nielsens during its nine-season run. It also spun off the long-running 'Petticoat Junction' (which, in turn, spun off 'Green Acres'), but a 1993 feature film based on the original proved unsuccessful.(n)

programme.title: Man With a Camera
programme.desc: Work's no snap for a freelance New York photographer who spends most of his time fighting crime. Reminiscent of the 1951-52 series 'Crime Photographer,' which starred Darren McGavin.(n)

programme.title: Dusty's Trail
programme.desc: A variation of 'Gilligan's Island' set in the Old West (with the same star, Bob Denver), this wacky Western about the various types traveling in a wagon train was created by 'Gilligan' producer Sherwood Schwartz and bit the dust after one season.(n)

programme.title: The Mooh Brothers
programme.desc: Two environmentally conscious cows run a farm full of silly animals.(n)

programme.title: The Houndcats
programme.desc: A clever 'Mission: Impossible' animated spoof about a team of cat and dog secret agents who receive their assignments from tape recordings that, of course, self-destruct.(n)

programme.title: The Barkleys
programme.desc: A cartoon variation on 'All in the Family' whose talking dogs include the blustery Arnie Barkley, howling opinions on everything from women's lib to the generation gap.(n)

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The masked man and Tonto rode from radio to TV with a 'hearty heigh-ho Silver, away!', accompanied by Rossini's stirring 'William Tell Overture.' ABC's first ratings hit and one of early TV's most popular series, it told of the lone survivor of an ambush of Texas Rangers, who was found by the Indian Tonto. Tonto helped his 'kemo sabe' (trusty scout) right wrongs...all without killing anyone. Clayton Moore also played the Lone Ranger in two 1950s theatrical films.(n)

programme.title: Legacy Of The Silver Shadow
programme.desc: A group of crime-fighting students uncover the underground headquarters of their arch-enemy, Silver Shadow.(n)

programme.title: The Genie from Down Under
programme.desc: Adventures of a young girl who discovers a genie from Australia.(n)

programme.title: Sky Trackers
programme.desc: Mike, Nikki and Maggie live beneath a space tracking station in the Australian outback. The scientists' children face a unique set of challenges while facing the normal issues of growing up.(n)

programme.title: Spellbinder II: Land of the Dragon Lord
programme.desc: The futuristic adventures of a teenage brother and sister trapped in a parallel universe ruled by a spoiled 12-year-old.(n)

programme.title: Escape from Jupiter
programme.desc: A sci-fi series set in a space station, where young refugees from a mining colony are stranded following a series of volcanic eruptions.(n)

programme.title: The Soupy Sales Show
programme.desc: An outrageous kids show (that adults could appreciate too) with a wacky host, puppets, sketches, blackouts and songs. This mayhem maven started in 1953 on a station in Detroit before going national on ABC and ultimately turning up in syndication. It was, literally, pie-in-the-face humor, with Sales claiming that he's had more than 25,000 whipped-cream facials. He was once given a week's suspension for asking young viewers to send him the 'little green pieces of paper' from their dads' wallets.(n)

programme.title: The Jerry Lewis Show
programme.desc: Jerry Lewis hosted two prime-time variety shows. One was a fiasco, the other ran for two seasons. The first was a big-budget, two-hour affair telecast live from Hollywood's El Capitan Theatre. It premiered with great fanfare, but was greeted rudely by critics and with apathy by viewers. Dick Cavett was one of its writers. In the other (an hourlong show), Lewis played his movie characters in sketches. The Osmonds were frequent guests. Les Brown was the bandleader for both series.(n)

programme.title: The Lucy Show
programme.desc: The TV icon plays a widow living with best bud Vivian and their kids while she works as a secretary for long-suffering banker Mr. Mooney. Five years after 'I Love Lucy,' and without Desi, Ball scored another hit series that showcased her gift for physical comedy and her chemistry with old cohort Vivian Vance (who left after the third season). After undergoing a format change in 1968, it was retitled 'Here's Lucy.'.(n)

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A widow and her three daughters (and Uncle Joe, who's a-movin' kinda slow) run the Shady Rest Hotel in Hooterville, whose clientele consists mainly of passengers on the spur line of an almost-defunct railroad. It was one of many rural sitcoms that populated CBS acreage during the 1960s (this series inspired---and shared characters with---the equally popular 'Green Acres'). Despite a revolving door of cast changes, the gentle, down-home comedy had a successful seven-year run.(n)

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: CBS hit a ratings gusher with this rustic sitcom about a poor mountaineer turned oil baron who relocated, along with his eccentric clan, to 'the hills of Beverly.' The series frequently topped the Nielsens during its nine-season run. It also spun off the long-running 'Petticoat Junction' (which, in turn, spun off 'Green Acres'), but a 1993 feature film based on the original proved unsuccessful.(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: The classic cop drama follows the cases of laconic Sgt. Joe Friday and his various sidekicks in storylines drawn from actual case files. Originally a radio vehicle for star Jack Webb, the Emmy-winning series was a pioneer in its realistic depiction of police work, though its staccato, just-the-facts dialogue and voice-over narration became the stuff of parody. The show proved enduringly popular, inspiring a 1954 feature, a 1987 spoof (with Dan Aykroyd and Tom Hanks) and a 2003 ABC revival.(n)

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: Adventures of the masked crimefighter and his assistant Kato that tried to duplicate the success of ABC's other dynamic superhero, 'Batman,' which had premiered earlier in the year. This series, an adaptation of a radio show, was played more seriously, though, and while it had its own style and received some praise, it languished in a Friday time slot and was canceled after one season. It became a cult favorite later, thanks largely to future martial-arts legend Bruce Lee, who played Kato.(n)

programme.title: Ray Bradbury Theater
programme.desc: The sci-fi author's works were adapted for this anthology series, which included appearances by notable actors.(n)

programme.desc: The sci-fi author's works were adapted for this anthology series, which included appearances by notable actors.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Esta serie aborda el comportamiento animal desde una perspectiva científica única. Si bien la mayoría de los shows con animales solo analizan los comportamientos externos de los animales, XPLORATION ANIMAL SCIENCE va un paso más allá, explorando por qué los animales pueden sobresalir en sus entornos y cómo se han adaptado para una supervivencia óptima.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Nature Knows Best
programme.desc: Producido principalmente para el público objetivo de 13-16 años, XPLORATION NATURE KNOWS BEST inspira y educa a audiencias de todas las edades. programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: La serie, ofrece una mirada en profundidad a las características distintivas del planeta Tierra.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050
programme.desc: Una serie dirigida a niños de 13 a 16 años explora cómo será el mundo en el año 2050, mientras expertos en diversos campos consideran cómo los avances en ciencia, tecnología, ingeniería y matemáticas afectarán el futuro.(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Una joven pareja es aterrorizada por tres intrusos enmascarados en una casa aislada en esta producción de terror y suspenso.(n)

programme.title: The Devil's Tomb
programme.desc: Cuba Gooding Jr. lidera este filme que combina una alta dosis de acción y terror. Un grupo de mercenarios se encuentra con un demonio antiguo cuando intenta rescatar a un científico de un laboratorio subterráneo en el desierto. programme.title: The Monuments Men
programme.desc: Los "Monuments Men", un grupo de intrépidos expertos en arte venidos de todos los puntos del planeta, se infiltran tras las líneas enemigas en Alemania con el fin de recuperar las obras de arte robadas por los nazis, antes de que Hitler ordenara su destrucción.(n)

programme.title: Red Water
programme.desc: Una pareja divorciada se ve envuelta con criminales y un tiburón asesino mientras realizan exploraciones de gas natural a lo largo de un río en Luisiana. Coolio hace una aparición breve.(n)

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci
programme.desc: El anfitrión de la serie, educador en ciencias y líder en el campo de la formación profesional educativa, Steve Spangler fomenta el descubrimiento de conceptos científicos a través de experimentos que los espectadores pueden realizar en casa.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Esta serie aborda el comportamiento animal desde una perspectiva científica única. Si bien la mayoría de los shows con animales solo analizan los comportamientos externos de los animales, XPLORATION ANIMAL SCIENCE va un paso más allá, explorando por qué los animales pueden sobresalir en sus entornos y cómo se han adaptado para una supervivencia óptima.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Nature Knows Best
programme.desc: Producido principalmente para el público objetivo de 13-16 años, XPLORATION NATURE KNOWS BEST inspira y educa a audiencias de todas las edades. Danni Washington, la bióloga anfitriona y marina, ilustra cómo la tecnología que nos rodea se inspira en la naturaleza y cómo los innovadores modernos continúan la práctica.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: La serie, ofrece una mirada en profundidad a las características distintivas del planeta Tierra.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050
programme.desc: Una serie dirigida a niños de 13 a 16 años explora cómo será el mundo en el año 2050, mientras expertos en diversos campos consideran cómo los avances en ciencia, tecnología, ingeniería y matemáticas afectarán el futuro.(n)

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space
programme.desc: Se exploran temas relacionados con el espacio.(n)

programme.title: Avengers: Los archivos secretos - Black Widow y Punisher
programme.desc: Punisher es tomado en custodia por la agente SHIELD Viuda Negra después de interferir con una misión de alto secreto. Más tarde, Punisher y Viuda Negra deben trabajar juntos para detener a la organización global terrorista Leviatán, que planea vender tecnología robada de SHIELD al mejor postor.(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers: Traitor of Mars
programme.desc: La acción transcurre tras los hechos de "Starship Troopers: Invasión". Johnny Rico ha sido degradado de General a Coronel, y enviado a un satélite de Marte para entrenar a nuevos reclutas. Pronto comprueba la dificultad de la tarea, debido al poco apoyo político y la actitud de los ciudadanos de Marte, que se creen a salvo de la guerra con los insectos. Al igual que los últimos títulos de la saga, esta película ha sido realizada en Japón con animación ultrarrealista.(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Cuando los alienígenas confunden las imágenes del juego Arcade por un signo de agresión, atacan la Tierra con las versiones malvadas de Pac-Man, Donkey Kong y otros personajes de videojuegos. programme.title: Coronation Street
Coronation Street - Eps. #10351
programme.desc: Gemma and Chesney have a decision to make. Bernie punishes Dev for bad-mouthing her. Billy gets a call from Summer's school.(n)

programme.title: Workin' Moms
